title: (x) $5 Jewelry - Book Jacket {Jill}
content:
Hi!!   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000443im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16442.jpg)   
   
Please identify the main type.   
   
Thank you!
author: misalion

comments.content:
Hi Misa,   
   
This font came with my Corel Draw 8.0. Its called Brochure (~Book Jacket). I am looking to see where you can find it on the web. See my example... ![$5](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000443im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16447.jpg)

Here ya go Misa...you can download the font here...   
 [http://www.fortunecity.com/westwood/saintlaurent/303/lazy.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000443/http:/www.fortunecity.com/westwood/saintlaurent/303/lazy.html)

It's interesting that in Jill's sample there's no trapping\*, while the original does have some - like in the "W".   
   
\* Sorry, I can't help it! :-)   
   
hhp

Either that, or it was printed out on an inkjet. Silkscreened onto vinyl. Photographed at close range with mad flash. Then scanned while moving the print. Perhaps a new method for auto trapping?   
   
That's not the prettiest alphabet ever drawn, is it? Kinda has a Danielle Steele quality to it :-) Jill great catch.

Misa, if the free font isn't working...   
Book Jacket, probably a better digitization, used   
to be an Image Club font...   
   
 [www.gettyimages.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000443/http:/www.gettyimages.com/)  
   
...here...? I forget all the links in Image Club's evolution.   
   
bj

Thanks a lot, Jill! I appreciate!!   
   
Hrant and Randy, original picture I got was this... to solve the mistery..   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000443im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/16470.jpg)   
Sorry I did not post this one, becase I wanted to get rid of unnecesary areas.   
   
bj, thank you for your extra info. My Illustrator got a little confused with a PC font, but I made it work.   
   
Thank you all!!
